info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:38PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL MONROE...EASTERN BEAVER...VENANGO...BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON... GREENE...ARMSTRONG...CLARION...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE...FOREST... WASHINGTON...WESTERN WESTMORELAND...OHIO...WETZEL...MARSHALL... BROOKE...NORTHWESTERN MONONGALIA AND MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EST... At 338 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Enterprise to near Powhatan Point. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, McMurray, McKeesport, and Butler. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 7 and 14. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 54. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 21 and 73. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 96. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 158 and 160. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 79. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 45 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
